name: Hotel Ibis Sydney Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not only did the Ibis try to overcharge us by $30 (apparently the rate quoted over the phone was wrong) but it wasn't even worth the $120 we paid. The room was absolutely tiny, with our suitcases on the floor there was no room to even walk around the bed. The bathroom was just ridiculous! It was no different to a bathroom on a boat and the whole floor was soaking wet within seconds of turning on the shower. By far the worst hotel we stayed in during our month long trip overseas...even the 1-2 star motels were better.
reviews.title: Avoid this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this property on two occasions, one on the way out of the country and 8 days later on the way back. I will admit that the girl was a bit of a sourpus at reception on our first check in however all round the hotel was fine. The room was far more spacious than I expected after the reviews I had read (in fact, the room was bigger than the Ibis Darling Harbour rooms!) the sheets and towels were fresh, crisp and clean, there was tea and coffee, and iron and board, flat screen tv, a mini fridge, desk and chair. The bed was a queen couldnt complain about that either. I called for extra pillows and I received within minutes. As for the bathroom namely the shower, we had no problems, we closed the glass door properly and used the floor mat (which got hardly wet) never had a problem.
reviews.title: For around $100 AUD pn, We thought it was fine

likes.liked: — Value for money, location to airport and public transport, cleanliness

reviews.text: Breakfast was cheap and quick and we enjoyed on both mornings. We even had dinner on our return leg as they boast to have no entree over 15 or main over 25 and the meals were huge. Drinks were also well priced I might add!
reviews.title: Compact,Comfortable,Very Busy

likes.liked: — Convenience to airport at a value price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was also an ATM and internet kiosk in the foyer at $ 2.00 per 20 mins - resonable I thought to get the job done.
reviews.title: Unable To Answer The Phone - No Business Skills

likes.disliked: — The lack of service at the front desk

reviews.text: We chose this property for cost and proximity to the Mascot train station which was an easy 7 min walk as we had other things to do while in transit in Sydney (like the Harbour Bridge Climb!- Amazing) And as mentioned in my title really for $ 100 I thought it was great. If I get a charming welcome at the front desk (im being sarcastic) i give it back to them plus 100 % in happieness, they so love that, but that was the only gripe. And on the second visit, got the most loveliest of fellas on check in so couldn't complain at all there!
reviews.title: Ok for 1 Night Stopover

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Hotel Ibis at Sydney Airport. The staff were courteous, the facilities basic and what I would have expected for a three star hotel.
reviews.title: Fungus Encounter at Hotel Ibis

reviews.text: It was just after checking into my room and using the bathroom that I noticed mould and fungal growths in the exhaust fan of the bathroom. I had never encountered the toad-stool-like fungus in any hotel before.
reviews.title: compact stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After being shown two other rooms, both with mould and fungus in their bathrooms as well, the Ibis had to move me to a different hotel altogether.
reviews.title: Great Stopover

reviews.text: I can't say that I would stay at the Ibis in the future, at least not until they could assure me that they could supply at least one hotel room without fungus.
reviews.title: Basic accomodation near the airport

reviews.text: This hotel must have been designed by a really small Japanese person. The rooms are incredibly compact - I found them a bit stifling but they are very clean and the beds are comfortable. When I got there there were guests who were queued up to complain to and yell at staff. The staff appeared to be used to it though. The staff were not warm and inviting and in my observation could have fixed some of the problems the guests raised by simply waiving a small charge or being more attentive.. They did not do this though. The menu after 10.30pm is very restricted and the kitchen didn't have any mustard on hand so I can't think they are too well equipped. The breakfast looked great though and the waiter there was sweet and helpful. I am not sure that this is the best value for money in town but the stay is ok if you have to leave early. The shuttle bus costs $5 to get to the airport but it is really only a $9 cab ride anyway so not alot to be saved there.
reviews.title: Avoid It!

reviews.text: I had to wait one day in Sidney for my next flight, so I needed a hotel that was close to the airport and with good connections. The hotel is quite basic, but served my purpose well. The airport shuttle is 5 AUD, but I think it is fair if compared to what you would pay with a taxi or even the train. If you are looking for a similar hotel in the area, I saw a Holiday Inn one block away that looked nicer (at least from the outside), so check the reviews.
reviews.title: Only good if want to stay near the airport to depart early morning

likes.disliked: — Walls are too thin so it gets noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good: the staff was professional and helpful. It is 500 meters away from "Mascot" train station, so you can easily move around with public transport . However, bear in mind that the area gets quite deserted during the night, so I wouldn't recommend it if you are planning to come late at night. Rooms are very small, in particular for Australian standards, but ok for staying overnight.
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.text: The so-so: the bathroom is really, really small (really!). It was ok for me, but I am not sure oversized people would fit in them. On top, it was a bit smelly. The room didn't feel 100% clean, but it could have been due to the stains in the carpet (to be fair, a previous gest had the bright idea of ironing in the carpet so it was burned...).
reviews.title: Clean rooms, happy staff and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bad: walls are VERY thin, so you get to hear all sorts of noises. It gets particularly bad if you have some aussie neighbours who went drinking and arrive late in the night (i.e. a 70% chance of experiencing it).
reviews.title: Smelly Ibis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Conveniently located to both the domestic and international terminals the Ibis is a good choice for an overnight stay on your way into or out of Sydney. Rooms are small and basic but are clean and have all the amenities you need, however the lighting in the rooms is not adequate. We were departing on a 14 hour flight in the afternoon so were hoping to get a sleep in but the room doors are quite heavy so we were awoken by the slamming doors (you can’t close them quietly) of other guests departing for morning flights. The hotel itself also has coin operated laundries and internet access which came in handy for us.
reviews.title: Ibis is solid for a night or two

likes.liked: — Close and convienient to domestic and international terminals.

reviews.text: Food at the hotel is average, and as with most properties located close to airports, a little on the pricey side. The shuttle bus service seems to work well going from the hotel to the airport but is a little confusing coming the other way, add to that our driver was rude and struggled with English. Staff at the hotel seem to lack motivation and there often seems to be underlying confusion amongst them.
reviews.title: Don't stay here!

reviews.text: I would recommend the Ibis Sydney Airport for stays of 1 to 2 nights only, any more than that I would suggest making the journey closer to the city.
reviews.title: Modest price, modest hotel

reviews.text: We were on a 3 week trip to visit family in Australia. On the last night of the trip we flew in from Hobart and arrived in Sydney to spend the last night of our trip near the airport for our flight out the next day. I called the hotel to arrange for the shuttle bus. I told them where we were (Terminal 2) and the guy said OK and that the shuttle bus would be by at 11:20. No other instructions were provided.
reviews.title: Good Airport Stay

likes.liked: — Proximity to the airport and price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 11:20 came and no shuttle bus. I called the hotel again and was told (by a different person) that we had to go to the shuttle bus stop. I was informed that the last shuttle was at 11:20 but it hadn't left the airport yet. I asked where the shuttle bus stop was. Got a really vague ‘there's a U you need to go stand by’ before being put permanently on hold. Some nice passerby finally showed us where the shuttle bus stop was but it soon became apparent that we had missed the last shuttle.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: I feel this is a quite ok hotel for stopover. However, if you wish to travel to city centre, I can this is not an ideal hotel coz it located far away from city centre but near to airport.
reviews.title: Comfort for stopover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shuttle service is also quite often and you will definitely not miss any flight unless you are a careless person.
reviews.title: Ok for A Stop Over

reviews.text: This hotel is very basic, but you get what you pay for and it is handy to the airport especially if you check in late and check out early. We had a bad experience checking in with the girl on reception, she was rather rude when I reminded her we had requested an early check in, but apart from that no problems.
reviews.title: affordable near the airport

reviews.text: The food was rather good and reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Conveneint For The Weary Traveller

reviews.text: This was my second stay at the Ibis Sydney Hotel. I really cant complain much other than it is a simple, non flashy, No Wow!, average little place very close to the airport. If you need a place to stay for a night or a layover this is perfect. I would not stay here for a vacation as there is really nothing going on in the area.
reviews.title: average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: staff are rude and nonchalant,
reviews.title: 2nd stay - happy once again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel as it's near the airport and boasted what we thought was free airport transfers.
reviews.title: Will not return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a 7 hr flight and a further 1hr clearing customs we just wanted to get to our hotel. We waited at our pick up point for 30 mins. No pick up! after calling the hotel we were told our pick up would arrive in 55 mins! bear in mind the hotel is just a 7min ride away. I don't think that's acceptable service. We took a taxi.
reviews.title: room was a pleasant surprise

likes.liked: — clean, comfortable, attractive and good value
likes.disliked: — 45 minute wait for airport-hotel shuttle service

reviews.text: We arrived and then had to queue for 30 mins to check in.
reviews.title: Small rooms, overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Meals were good (see comments later) but there appeared to be something wrong with the hotel A/C which seemed to be at 14 degrees, most guests were eating wearing Winter woolies.
reviews.title: Convenient to Airport, good breakfast menu.

likes.liked: — Proximity to airport and car rentals.

description: Ibis Sydney Airport - the only AAA rated 3.5 star property at Sydney Airport. We are 100% non smoking with restaurant, bar, internet access, guest laundry and car parking. Ibis - Hotels the way you like them.
